column2: CONNECTICUT PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
column6: CT

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. If you are about to be hit from behind, do NOT:
column6: press yourself against the back of your seat.

column2: 2. Most signs used in street work areas are:
column6: rectangle shaped.

column2: 3. ___________ are green with white letters and symbols.
column6: Regulation signs (regulatory signs)

column2: 4. When parking on a public road, drivers should:
column4: move as far away from traffic as possible.
column6: always park on the left side of the roadway.

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column6: Sharp turn to the left

column2: 6. When preparing to exit an expressway, drivers should start reducing their speed:
column4: about halfway through the deceleration lane.
column6: at least 100 feet before entering the deceleration lane.
column8: immediately upon entering the deceleration lane.

column2: 7. Any use of a cell phone while operating a motor vehicle is considered a distraction because:
column4: it draws the attention of other drivers.
column6: it causes the driver to be concerned about the latest news.
column8: it occupies the driver's mind, hands and eyes.

column2: 8. Your BAC depends on:
column6: how much time passes between drinks.

column2: 9. When driving behind a motorcycle, drivers should:
column6: slow down.
column8: be ready to sound the horn.

column2: 10. If you miss your exit on a freeway, do NOT:
column6: continue on the freeway and find an alternative route.
column8: get back on the freeway in the opposite direction and return to the exit you want.

column2: 11. Vertical rectangles tell drivers:
column6: what is not allowed.

column2: 12. It is unlawful­ to:
column4: pass within 150 feet of any railroad crossing.
column6: exceed the posted speed limit when passing.
column8: pass within 250 feet of any intersection.

column2: 13. If you drive slower than the flow of traffic, you will most likely:
column4: help create a safe driving environment.
column6: interfere with traffic and receive a ticket.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column6: No U-turn

column2: 15. If your vehicle has a two part safety belt system:
column6: be sure to wear both the lap belt and the shoulder belt.

column2: 16. This sign means:
column4: The road will curve to the right, then to the left.
column6: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column8: Road slippery when wet. Drive slowly.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column4: A road joins from the right
column6: All traffic must turn right
column8: All traffic must go straight ahead

column2: 18. Yellow traffic signs:
column4: when combined with an octagonal shape, tell drivers they must come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.
column6: warn drivers.

column2: 19. A broken yellow line to the right of a solid yellow center line means:
column4: you are only allowed to make left turns in this area.
column6: passing is prohibited.
column8: you may pass other vehicles if no oncoming traffic is present.

column2: 20. When driving on packed snow you should:
column6: reduce your speed by about 10 MPH.
